subject: Re: [junit] Re: Help plz...
msgSnippet: ... The bytecode has a reference into the constant pool, that s true; that has a space consequence (the name has to be somewhere) and a time consequence (the
messageBody:
On Tuesday 23 September 2003 22:13, Jim Dixon wrote:

> Look at the bytecode. Whenever you call
> com.funnyfarm.toplevel.deeper.deeperstill.getondown.WeAreFinallyThere,
> it's in the bytecode, each and every character.

The bytecode has a reference into the constant pool, that's true; that has
a space consequence (the name has to be somewhere) and a time
consequence (the name has to be looked up at least once, and longer
names will take longer to be looked up).

But I can't imagine [1] that this lookup is done *each and every time* the
call is executed - jitty things will at some point switch to a direct[ish]
call, and the name at that point becomes irrelevant. Similarly for field
references - once you execute them, they can be replaced by offsets,
name lookup goes bye-byes. So there's a cost, but I'd expect it to be
tiny in comparison to the real work going on.

[1] Well, OK, I *can* imagine this, just as I can imagine falling out of a
hot-air balloon, drowning in acid, or my body being taken over by a
nanovirus. I can also imagine suffering from the speed loss for about
ten seconds before I decide to switch implementations.

--
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
